titles.title: Lincoln County Land Act of 1999
Lincoln County Land Act of 2000
Lincoln County Land Act of 2000
Lincoln County Land Act of 2000
To give Lincoln County, Nevada, the right to purchase at fair market value certain public land located within that county, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Energy and Mineral Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 106-847.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 502.

action.text: Mr. Hansen moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2752.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.

calendar.text: Received in the Senate. Read twice. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 836.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 9/26/2000--Passed House amended. Lincoln County Land Act of 2000 - Directs the Secretary of the Interior to dispose of certain land in Lincoln County, Nevada, in a competitive bidding process, at a minimum, for fair market value. Sets forth certain requirements with respect to the disposal of such land and disposition of sale proceeds. Authorizes the Secretary to acquire environmentally sensitive land from the proceeds from the sale of such land.
